headline: BlackRock: Ethereum Is Anchoring Wall Street's Tokenization Race
summary: The Ethereum network underpins 65% of tokenized assets, BlackRock said in its 2026 thematic outlook.

headline: What Bubble? Nvidia CEO Says AI Needs Trillions More in Investments
summary: Nvidia's CEO told the World Economic Forum that AI infrastructure needs trillions more in investment to avoid a bubble collapse—even as fears mount that the industry is already overheating.

headline: Bitcoin’s quantum threat sparks concern on Wall Street
summary: UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti said at Davos this week that Bitcoin needs to overcome the quantum computing threat. Ermotti joins a growing chorus of concerned financiers that includes Jefferies’ head of equity strategy Christopher Wood, who removed Bitcoin from a recommended pension portfolio last week. Bitcoin developers are in denial, crypto venture capitalist Nic Carter told DL News.

headline: Trump Warns Powell Won’t Be ‘Very Happy’ If He Stays on at Fed
summary: “We’ll see how it all works out,” Trump said in an interview from Davos, Switzerland with CNBC that aired Wednesday.  The Trump administration has intensified its fight against the current Fed chair, issuing subpoenas hinting at a possible criminal probe into the central bank’s renovation of its Washington headquarters.

headline: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Warns AI Could Lose 'Social Permission' If It Burns Energy Without Real-World Benefits In Health And Education
summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) CEO Satya Nadella says artificial intelligence faces a test: prove it improves people's lives or risk losing public trust. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Tuesday in a wide-ranging discussion with BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) CEO Larry Fink, Nadella said AI's massive energy use will only be tolerated if it delivers tangible results in areas like health care, education and productivity. “We will quickly lose even the social permission to actually tak

headline: Private credit may be the breakout use case for tokenization: Maple's Sidney Powell
summary: Maple Finance CEO Sidney Powell said blockchain’s biggest opportunity isn’t tokenized Treasury bills or funds — instead, it’s bringing opaque, illiquid private credit markets onchain.

headline: Nvidia Links AI Expansion to Data Center Jobs Boom
summary: CEO Jensen Huang says AI-driven data center buildouts are boosting vocational wages as Nvidia's data center sales surge.

summary: The first-of-its-kind FIA, according to the companies, offers crypto exposure with principal protection, aiming to attract cautious investors near retirement.

summary: CEO Jensen Huang forecasts trillion-dollar AI buildout at Davos.

headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says ‘a lot’ of six-figure jobs in plumbing and construction are about to be unlocked because someone needs to build all these new AI centers
summary: The AI boom is threatening white-collar entry jobs—but it’s creating a booming six-figure opportunity for electricians, plumbers, and construction workers.

headline: Supreme Court Wary Of Hurting Fed Independence (Live Coverage)
summary: The Supreme Court will hear arguments starting at 10 a.m. ET over President Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve Gov. Lisa Cook for cause.  The case will determine whether Trump gets another Fed appointment to help him shift monetary policy in a dovish direction.  Trump also is set to announce his choice for the next Fed chairman in coming days.

headline: Jensen Huang says AI bubble fears are dwarfed by ‘the largest infrastructure buildout in human history’
summary: Huang sees the AI industry as a "five-layer cake" requiring total industrial reinvention, with Nvidia's chips a particularly crunchy part of the recipe.

headline: BlackRock names crypto and tokenization as ‘themes driving markets’ in 2026
summary: The $10 trillion asset manager includes bitcoin, ether and stablecoins in its 2026 outlook, spotlighting blockchain as a rising force in modern finance.

headline: Trump at Davos: I'll announce new Fed chair very soon
summary: President Trump stated that he is close to announcing his nominee to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve in his address at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday. Current Fed Chair Jerome Powell's term is set to end in May. Be sure to check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on each of the possible candidates to be the next Fed chair: National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. Yahoo Finance interviewed Kevin Hassett in late November 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Trump: Will Name Next Federal Reserve Chair in 'Not-Too-Distant Future’
summary: President Trump said he will announce a nominee to chair the Federal Reserve “in the not-too-distant future” and said of his coming choice: “He’ll do a very good job—see, I gave away some of it—‘he.’” Trump has repeatedly slammed Fed Chair Jerome Powell, whose term ends in May.

headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: 'Trillions of dollars of AI infrastructure needs to be built'
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang told an audience at the gathering of the World Economic Forum that the world needs to build trillions of dollars of AI infrastructure to meet demand.

headline: Wealth Tech Market Research Report 2026-2031
summary: The WealthTech market, valued at USD 9 billion in 2025, is expected to surge to USD 21 billion by 2031 with a CAGR of 15.17%. Key to this growth are advancements in AI, machine learning, and blockchain, enhancing robo-advisors, portfolio management software, and digital financial planning. These technologies provide rapid, personalized investment strategies and improve financial inclusion. headline: Trump delays Fed chair decision while at Davos
summary: Investing.com -- President Trump has not yet decided on his nominee for Federal Reserve chair and will not make an announcement during his visit to Davos, a White House official told reporters on Wednesday.

headline: Nvidia CEO Says Trillions More Needed for AI Buildout
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the infrastructure around artificial intelligence will need trillions of dollars in additional investment over the coming years. He made the comments during a conversation with BlackRock's Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland.

headline: AI will create jobs, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang argues
summary: Speaking with BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang spoke about how AI will help create more jobs, not eliminate them as many fear. Watch the full conversation with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang.

summary: BlackRock Vice Chairman Philipp Hildebrand discusses the changing world order, Europe's role and the impact of the artificial intelligence boom on inflation. He speaks on Bloomberg Television at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland.
